intro: Anthacanthus acicularis, commonly known as the needle-leaf anthacanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in temperate regions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
